rev.comment: /* Digital rights management in Google Video */ Needs sources on that, can't find anything myself. Repost if you've got something!
rev.diff:
Line 201: Line 201:
===Digital rights management in Google Video===
===Digital rights management in Google Video===
â
Announced on [[January 6]], [[2006]] at the CES in Las Vegas, the Google Video Store sells copyrighted content at the Google Video website. Initially this service is restricted to the United States and certain other countries. <!--I think, doesn't work in the UK anyway--> To protect the copyright of these popular shows such as [[MacGyver]] and [[The Twilight Zone]], Google created a Google DRM ([[Digital Rights Management]]) lock for certain paid content. The fact by itself that Google was using DRM was enough to cause criticism by some bloggers, even before Google Video was launched. The design of the system also has minor privacy implications that Google does not make explicit on their Video site; namely, Google learns who purchases each movie and what computers they watch it on. [http://www.freedom-to-tinker.com/?p=956] It is unknown whether the Google Video Player software sends personal information to Google, as in [[Windows Media Player]]; Google has not commented on this.
+
Announced on [[January 6]], [[2006]] at the CES in Las Vegas, the Google Video Store sells copyrighted content at the Google Video website. Initially this service is restricted to the United States and certain other countries. <!--I think, doesn't work in the UK anyway--> To protect the copyright of these popular shows such as [[MacGyver]] and [[The Twilight Zone]], Google created a Google DRM ([[Digital Rights Management]]) lock for certain paid content. The fact by itself that Google was using DRM was enough to cause criticism by some bloggers, even before Google Video was launched. The design of the system also has minor privacy implications that Google does not make explicit on their Video site; namely, Google learns who purchases each movie and what computers they watch it on [http://www.freedom-to-tinker.com/?p=956].
